name: Jimmy Cash
precedingDialogue: Mrs mayor, we have quite a bit of excess cash for city development, it is usually a good idea to invest these into something that can be useful down the road.
We have a few proposals from both small businesses and our local university asking us to support their projects, they all seem very interesting.
question: What would you like to fund?

transitions.label: An electric car company
transitions.feedback: Electric cars are all the rage these days, and they save the environment, what a deal!

transitions.label: A material science research group
transitions.feedback: Material science helps with industry, and that's money!

transitions.label: A clean energy research group
transitions.feedback: Clean energy is not easy, but it can save the world in the future!

name: Arvio
precedingDialogue: Greetings! My name is Arvio, but people call me Arvio The Wealthy
Why? I'm the proprietor of MineCroft Coal Mines and the wealthiest coal baron on the seven mountains
My team of Geo ...erm ...geolis ...scientists, say that this town's neighbouring mountains promises bounds of wealth'
I have a proposition for you, allow me to inspect those lands and I may consider helping out this dump *erherm* town!
question: So what do you say friend? Do we have a deal?

transitions.label: There's a lot of money in coal. Go ahead!
transitions.feedback: Arvio brings his crew and begins inspecting your land.

transitions.label: No deal, mining for coal will ruin the natural landscape!
transitions.feedback: Arvio leaves with a mischievous look on his face.

name: Hunter Gatberg
precedingDialogue: [Ring Ring... Ring Ring...]
Hey Mum! We learnt about polar bears today, they look so cute. I would love to be able to see them one day.
question: Could you take me on a trip someday?

name: Advisory Board

name: Advisory Board
precedingDialogue: The scientists have said that the world is getting warmer because of all the things we're building,
Cars and factories can make it worse, protecting the environment and planting trees help make it better
question: If we don't make it better, it can cause bad weather events, even floods!

name: James the Dog
precedingDialogue: Woof! [Mrs. Gatburg, your town is growing fast. however, this means that our power station is chocking]
Woof! [The citizens are not happy with the high electricity prices, we should consider building a bigger power station.]
question: Woof! [What kind of power plant should we build?]

transitions.label: Let's build a solar farm
transitions.feedback: Woof! [Solar panels are great for the environment, and with the efforts of the research group prices has been lowered significantly.]

transitions.label: Lets expand the coal plant
transitions.feedback: Woof! [It's a shame that you invested in solar energy but never used it :( plus coal is bad for the environment.]

precedingDialogue: Mrs. Gatberg, our prediction was dead-on! Your land is rich with coal!

transitions.label: Yes go ahead!
transitions.feedback: Arvio begins constructing an coal mine. We're getting paid a great amount of money, but this is releasing a lot of CO2.

transitions.label: No, go away Arvio.

name: Allena
precedingDialogue: Peter the mayor from our neighbouring city sent you a letter asking for your advice
They want to scale their city, and they're wondering if they should build up or out
question: How would you advise them?

transitions.label: They should build up
transitions.feedback: Building up can be expensive, but makes it easier to have sustainable transport. Peter thanks you for your advice.

transitions.label: They should build out
transitions.feedback: Building out is cheaper, but people drive more harms the environment. Peter takes your advice anyhow.

name: James the Dog
precedingDialogue: Woof! [Our city is getting so big that we're struggling to provide enough food!]
Woof! [People don't ever want to have to choose between overpriced food and hunger!!]
question: Woof! [Should we increase our farming efforts or import more food?]

transitions.label: Import some from neighbouring cities.
transitions.feedback: Woof! [Buying food is expensive, even though it doesn't increase our city's pollutions.]

transitions.label: We should have more farms in the city.
transitions.feedback: Woof! [Farming is important, but it does a lot of damage to the environment, be careful!]

name: James the Dog
precedingDialogue: Woof! [There's farming and there's farming, humans are omnivores and we have choices to make]
question: Woof! [Should we encourage dairy farming or vegetable farming?]

transitions.label: Dairy
transitions.feedback: Woof! [People like dairy, that's for sure! But dairy farming is real bad for the environment.]

transitions.label: Vegetable
transitions.feedback: Woof! [You made happy both the environment and lactose intolerant people]

name: Allena
precedingDialogue: Your neighbouring city is having a bad drought from damaging the environment too much
question: Should we give them a hand?

transitions.label: Yes definitely!
transitions.feedback: That was really kind of you!

transitions.label: No, we can't afford that!
transitions.feedback: It's understandable, that was a tough ask.

name: Allena
precedingDialogue: Our city is having a bad drought, we really shouldn't have support so much dairy farming
question: Please take more care with our environment in the future!

name: Jimmy Cash
precedingDialogue: People love living in the city, but they drive everywhere, that's pretty bad for our environment
question: How should we make transport better?

transitions.label: Promote electric vehicles!
transitions.feedback: Electric cars are much greener, plus our earlier investment made them cheap too. What a deal!

transitions.label: Lets beef up our public transport!
transitions.feedback: Public transport is a lot greener, but they're pretty pricey.

transitions.label: Let's keep letting people drive what they wish.
transitions.feedback: Not wise, petrol cars are really bad for your environment.
